public class Surface
extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.FocusWidget

The surface that an application uses to render to the screen.

CSS Style Rules

  • .g2d-Surface { }

Author:
hao1300@gmail.com
See Also:
http://dev.w3.org/html5/spec/Overview.html#the-canvas-element

save

public Surface save()
Pushes the current state onto the stack. Drawing states consist of:
  • The current transformation matrix.
  • The current clipping region.
  • The current values of the following attributes: strokeStyle, fillStyle, globalAlpha, lineWidth, lineCap, lineJoin, miterLimit, shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY, shadowBlur, shadowColor, globalCompositeOperation, font, textAlign, textBaseline.
Note: The current path and the current bitmap are not part of the drawing state.

Returns:
self to support chaining.

restore

public Surface restore()
Pops the top state on the stack, restoring the context to that state. Sees save() method on what can being saved and restored.

Returns:
self to support chaining.

rotateAnticlockwise

@Deprecated
public Surface rotateAnticlockwise(double angle)
Deprecated. 

Rotates anti-clockwise by the given angle about the origin. Use rotateCcw(double) as this method name is too long and ccw is more widely used than anticlockwise.

Parameters:
angle -

setLineWidth

public Surface setLineWidth(double lineWidth)
Sets the width of lines, in coordinate space units. On setting, zero, negative, infinite, and NaN values must be ignored, leaving the value unchanged. Default: 1.0.

Returns:
self to support chaining.

Returns:
self to support chaining.

public LineJoin getLineJoin()

setMiterLimit

public Surface setMiterLimit(double miterLimit)
Sets the current miter limit ratio. The miter length is the distance from the point where the join occurs to the intersection of the line edges on the outside of the join. The miter limit ratio is the maximum allowed ratio of the miter length to half the line width. If the miter length would cause the miter limit ratio to be exceeded, this second triangle must not be rendered. The miter limit ratio can be explicitly set using the miterLimit attribute. On setting, zero, negative, infinite, and NaN values must be ignored, leaving the value unchanged. Default: 10.0.

Returns:
self to support chaining.

getMiterLimit

public double getMiterLimit()
Gets the current miter limit ratio.

drawFocusRing

public boolean drawFocusRing(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget widget,
                             double x,
                             double y)
This is equivalent to calling drawFocusRing(widget, x, y, false).

See Also:
drawFocusRing(Widget, double, double)

drawFocusRing

public boolean drawFocusRing(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget widget,
                             double x,
                             double y,
                             boolean canDrawCustom)
Use this method to indicate which focusable part of the canvas is currently focused, passing it the widget for which a ring is being drawn. This method only draws the focus ring if the widget is focused, so that it can simply be called whenever drawing the widget, without checking whether the widget is focused or not first. The position of the center of the control, or of the editing caret if the control has one, should be given in the x and y arguments. WARNING: This method may not be implemented in most browsers yet!

Parameters:
canDrawCustom - if true, then the focus ring is only drawn if the user has configured his system to draw focus rings in a particular manner. (For example, high contrast focus rings.)

getImageData

public ImageDataAdapter getImageData(double x,
                                     double y,
                                     double width,
                                     double height)
Returns an ImageData object representing the underlying pixel data for the area of the context denoted by the rectangle whose corners are the four points (x, y), (x + width, y), (x + width, y + height), (x, y + height), in context coordinate space units. Pixels outside the context must be returned as transparent black. Pixels must be returned as non-premultiplied alpha values.

Parameters:
x -
y -
width -
height -

getImageData

public ImageDataAdapter getImageData(Rectangle rect)
Returns an ImageData object representing the underlying pixel data for the area of the context denoted by the given rectangle, in context coordinate space units. Pixels outside the context must be returned as transparent black. Pixels must be returned as non-premultiplied alpha values.

Parameters:
rect -

putImageData

public void putImageData(ImageDataAdapter imageData,
                         double x,
                         double y,
                         double dirtyX,
                         double dirtyY,
                         double dirtyWidth,
                         double dirtyHeight)

Paints the data from the given ImageData object onto the context. Only the pixels from the dirty rectangle are painted.

The globalAlpha and globalCompositeOperation attributes, as well as the shadow attributes, are ignored for the purposes of this method call; pixels in the context are replaced wholesale, with no composition, alpha blending, no shadows, etc.

Parameters:
imageData -
x -
y -
dirtyX -
dirtyY -
dirtyWidth -
dirtyHeight -

putImageData

public void putImageData(ImageDataAdapter imageData,
                         Vector2 position,
                         Rectangle dirtyRect)

Paints the data from the given ImageData object onto the context. Only the pixels from the dirty rectangle are painted.

The globalAlpha and globalCompositeOperation attributes, as well as the shadow attributes, are ignored for the purposes of this method call; pixels in the context are replaced wholesale, with no composition, alpha blending, no shadows, etc.

Parameters:
imageData -
position -
dirtyRect -
